name: Chau Long Sapa Hotel II

reviews.text: I was bumped from the Royal View and ended up here after complaining to my Vietnamese travel agent about the horrible place they wanted to put me. While not great, certainly fine for one night. In the center of things and popular with groups.
reviews.title: OK for one night in Sapa

reviews.text: The room was quiet, comfortable, very well heated (important!) albeit with a musty smell. The bathroom was clean with an unusally large tub.
reviews.title: Not worth the money!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast was good, the lobby shabby and lots of old gym equipment lying around on the terrace. A couple of ancient, but free, Internet PCs in the lobby.
reviews.title: Mixed feelings as lobby unwelcoming & lacks ambience but rooms comfortable

likes.liked: — Location, comfortable bed and plenty of hot water

reviews.text: If there hadn't been fog, which is pretty common in Sapa, the view would have been great.
reviews.title: Don't be a cheapskate

likes.disliked: — weather was out of our control

reviews.title: great view, great breakfasts, good massage, dodgy pool
reviews.text: Since I have yet to see good reviews of any hotels in Sapa, this is probably as good a place to stay as any and probably better than most.

Sapa is a gorgeous region, but it is has not yet opened itself to luxury tourism. Chau long is a nice place and has great views on the mountains from every room, but the swimming pool, bathroom,etc.. was not very clean. Breakfast is average, but their massages are good.
reviews.title: Nice view but not very clean

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stay in the new wing was great. Spectacular views, nice big room and extremely friendly, helpful staff. Very accomodating of early arrival and late departure and staff are very knowledgable about local attractions.
reviews.title: Great place to stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Sapa overall is beautiful but weather (cloud) can be a problem and some of the local people are the most persistant (annoying!) sellers I have encountered.
reviews.title: Great views (I think)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a room with great views except it was cloudy all through our stay. Nice hotel with a European atmosphere. Helpful staff, great room and a good location.
reviews.title: Stay here if you can afford it and want to be able to sleep

likes.liked: — Quiet room, comfortable bed, robe & slippers

reviews.text: Chau Long was a pleasant stay with professional staff. We stayed in the new wing. The rooms were comfortable and way better than most other rooms in Sapa. We originally checked into another hotel and decided to move. We looked at five hotels in Sapa before deciding on the Chau Long, even though it is 3X the price of the other hotels we looked at (and most other hotels in general). If you are a heavy sleeper, most other hotels will be fine. But there is a lot of construction going on in Sapa and most hotels have thin walls. We stayed at the Chau Long because after a rough night's sleep on the train, we really wanted a comfortable, quiet room. The breakfast was not very good, they seemed to try to offer too many things. I opened a bowl of dates (I think) and let out several dozen fruit flies and our omelette was undercooked a little. The poor breakfast doesn't mean you shouldn't stay here though, if you want a clean quiet room. And the views are great.
reviews.title: SaPa......... fantastic place, Great Hotel !!!

likes.liked: — Clean, comfortable, great staff and the girls LOVED the Massages !!!!

reviews.text: It has already been 2 months since we made a four weeks tour to Vietnam. Sapa was definitely the best area we have seen, especially because of the great advice we got from the people at the reception. Furthermore, we got very detailed information, because some of the people of the tour desk had walked or developed the tours themselves. We found the hotel staff helpful, sympathetic and an expert in great customer services. Especially Sabina! Every morning started with a delicious breakfast buffet, while we were having a stunning, panoramic view over the Sapa valley. The Chau Long Hotel was one of the few hotels that have such nice view. In addition, the bedrooms were fine and comfortable. Though, this was not the most important thing for us, because we only spent our nights there. The beautiful surroundings and people were the most important things for us. All in all, we would recommend this hotel to everybody who wants to have a combination of a comfortable stay and great custom made tours. Ask for the Mhuong Khong tour to the Chinese border!!
reviews.title: Sapa and Chau Long Hotel.....a great experience

reviews.text: Have a great time!
reviews.title: Has seen better times...

reviews.text: The hotel is nice but needs an update of the facilities. Owners seem to know and they are doing some works.
reviews.title: Wonderful experinece!

reviews.title: great view great service
reviews.text: i am back from sapa , where I had an amazing five nights stay at Chau Long . The hotel front office team surprised me by its attention to detail in every aspect of their service. Tired after the night train , it was relieving to be able to check fast at o700 Am. The front office staff escorted me to the room and gave me some short describtion about the place offering .The entire check in was really very prompt.The room was very pleasent and i stayed at the new renovated wing . BUt what I liked most was the view from my window -it was mindblowing.
The spa center is but well designed and i highly recomand to try Queen massage -the best i ever had ...and i did many .
reviews.title: OK hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: For all travelers, the location is great, and in the middle of Sapa . The hotel has a free shuttle service to the night train. As i said before The staff at the front desk managed by a nice lady Sabina were all extremely polite and very helpful to find some nice trekking options and even one day bike tour which i loved very much.
reviews.title: Good hotel in centre of town

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall, I think it is a great Hotel. I am very pleased with their hospitality and plan to return in my next trip
reviews.title: Nice hotel in Sapa

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Only stayed one night as part of our package. Train ride there and back was interesting but a must do. Rooms were very dated in their appearance but beds were comfortable and the room clean with good towels etc. Breakfast was nice and we did eat lunch there on first day which was ok. View was sensational and we were lucky enough to have a balcony with a view overlooking the mountains and the valley. Give the pool a big miss, the water is green and is situated in a large glass shaped room, like a humid spa so one could only imagine what little nasties are lurking. My young son insisted on having a dip but I warned him not to put his head under the water.
reviews.title: Good view and breakfast

description: Chau Long Sapa Hotel 2 is still the best location in Sapa, thus all the rooms freshly renovated (new floor + beds + flat TV) you will have a breathtaking view to the mountains and Muong Hoa Valley on your private balcony. The hotel offers free Internet facilities for its guests and also have the best tours and trekkings in Sapa area with local guides. Come see by yourself and experience the difference.
